summary: Build an earthquake detection web site using open-source internet data and modern web UI elements/libraries.
architectural_notes: For map marker popups, disable Leaflet popup auto-pan (bindPopup options { autoPan: false }) to prevent map jumping/minimizing on marker click.
Normalize/trim filter inputs (e.g., search query) before applying client-side filtering so whitespace/empty strings do not hide results.

To prevent UI lag with large datasets (e.g., Past Week), optimize rendering by (1) only rendering Leaflet markers within current visible map bounds and (2) virtualizing/limiting the number of table rows rendered at once.
Ensure results table container uses a proper height/overflow strategy (e.g., flex layout with min-h-0 and overflow-auto) so the bottom rows aren’t clipped on smaller viewports.
known_issues: Interactive map marker popup causes the map to jump/minimize when clicking a marker (Leaflet popup autoPan behavior).
Past month USGS earthquake feed data not appearing in the table due to overly strict client-side filtering (e.g., whitespace in search query).
App becomes laggy when switching the time window from Past Hour to Past Week due to rendering too many table rows and Leaflet markers at once.

Selecting Past Week/Past Month appears to include events from smaller time windows (Past Hour/Day) instead of showing only events within the chosen window; needs correct time-window-only filtering/sorting.
Earthquake results table/list appears cropped at the bottom (likely container height/overflow/layout issue).

existing_features.title: Create a responsive Earthquake Detection web app that pulls recent earthquake events from open-source internet data (USGS Earthquake Hazards Program GeoJSON feeds) and presents them in a modern UI.
Implement data fetching, caching, and loading/error states using React Query for USGS earthquake feeds, including automatic refresh.
Provide feed selection and filtering controls for earthquake events, including at minimum: time window (e.g., past hour/day/week), minimum magnitude slider/input, and a text search over place/region.

Display earthquake events in a modern component-based layout using shadcn/ui elements (tables/cards/badges/dialogs), including an event details view that shows: magnitude, location/place, timestamp, depth (if available), and source links.

Add a simple “detection” indicator/dashboard summary: total events in the selected window, count of events above user-selected magnitude threshold, and the largest magnitude event in the current results.

Apply a coherent, distinctive visual theme across the app (colors, typography, spacing, and component styling) suitable for an earthquake monitoring dashboard, using Tailwind and existing UI components; avoid blue/purple as the primary palette.

Add the required generated static images to the frontend as assets and render them in the UI (e.g., in header/landing area) from frontend/public/assets/generated without routing images through the backend.
Add a live/interactive map view to the Earthquake dashboard that plots the currently loaded and filtered USGS earthquake events by latitude/longitude as clickable markers.
Provide a clear UI control on the dashboard to switch between viewing results as a table, as a map, or as a split view showing both (map + table), without removing existing functionality.
Enable marker interaction so that selecting a marker opens the existing earthquake details view for that event, consistent with selecting a row in the results table.
Prevent the interactive Leaflet map from panning/zooming/jumping ("minimize") when the user clicks an earthquake marker by disabling Leaflet popup auto-pan behavior for marker popups.

Fix the Past Month (all_month.geojson) table results not appearing by making the place/region search filter robust to leading/trailing whitespace and whitespace-only input, so that Past Month results are not accidentally filtered out by stale or malformed search input.

Fix the UI layering/z-index so that when the Earthquake Details dialog is opened (e.g., by clicking a Leaflet map marker), the dialog overlay and dialog content always render above the Leaflet map tiles/markers/controls in all view modes (Map and Split), matching expected modal behavior.

Add a regression-safe styling adjustment to ensure Leaflet’s internal panes/controls do not create unexpected stacking contexts that can overtake app modals, without editing any read-only shadcn/ui component source files under frontend/src/components/ui.
Update the top-left header branding text in the dashboard to replace "Seismic Monitor" with "WhoFeelAnEarthquake".
Update the website/document title to use "WhoFeelAnEarthquake" so the browser tab title matches the new site name.
Update any relevant accessibility/user-facing alt text that currently says "Seismic Monitor" to match the new site name "WhoFeelAnEarthquake".

Add a new "Tsunami" column to the earthquake results table (frontend/src/components/earthquake/EarthquakeResultsTable.tsx) that displays a clear warning indicator based on the USGS GeoJSON field properties.tsunami (UsgsFeature.properties.tsunami).

Add favicon assets generated from the uploaded icon (eq-logo.dim_512x512.png) to the frontend public assets, and update the HTML head to reference them so browsers display the icon in the tab/address bar.

In the earthquake details popup (frontend/src/components/earthquake/EarthquakeDetailsDialog.tsx), add an MMI (Modified Mercalli Intensity) scale status line directly below the existing “Status” line, using the USGS GeoJSON field properties.mmi (UsgsFeature.properties.mmi).

Display the MMI value as both a numeric intensity (rounded to a sensible precision) and a clear Mercalli category label based on standard MMI bands (e.g., I–II Not felt, III Weak, IV Light, V Moderate, VI Strong, VII Very strong, VIII Severe, IX Violent, X Extreme, XI–XII Catastrophic).

Optimize the Leaflet map rendering so switching from smaller to larger USGS time windows (e.g., Past Hour → Past Week) does not freeze the UI by rendering only earthquakes that are within the current visible map bounds (plus a small optional padding), and updating the rendered marker set when the user pans/zooms the map.

Optimize the earthquake results table rendering so switching from smaller to larger USGS time windows (e.g., Past Hour → Past Week) does not lag by virtualizing or otherwise limiting the number of rendered rows at once while preserving table columns, styling, row selection, and the external link action.

When the user selects the USGS time window "Past Week" or "Past Month", ensure the displayed earthquake list (table, map, stats, and details selection) is restricted to only events whose properties.time falls within the selected window (week = last 7 days; month = last 30 days), so results are not effectively treated as starting from smaller windows (hour/day) or containing older-than-window items.

For all time windows (Past Hour/Day/Week/Month), sort the displayed earthquake results by event time descending (most recent first) after applying the time-window restriction and other filters, so Past Week/Past Month lists do not appear to "start" with smaller-window ordering artifacts.

Add a new "Moment Tensor" column to the earthquake results table (frontend/src/components/earthquake/EarthquakeResultsTable.tsx) that indicates whether moment tensor data is available for each event, using the existing USGS feed field UsgsFeature.properties.types (comma-separated product list).

Enhance the earthquake details dialog (frontend/src/components/earthquake/EarthquakeDetailsDialog.tsx) to fetch the USGS event detail JSON from the selected event’s properties.detail URL and display a "Moment Tensor" section in the popup when the detail response contains moment tensor product data.

Extend the TypeScript typing layer to support parsing the USGS event detail response needed for moment tensor display, without breaking existing USGS feed typing (frontend/src/lib/usgsTypes.ts and/or a new dedicated type module under frontend/src/lib).

Update the dashboard Hero Section (in frontend/src/pages/EarthquakeDashboard.tsx) to remove the current hero/banner image and replace it with a centered title text that reads exactly: "Real - Time Earthquake Detection Around The World".

Reduce the font size of the centered Hero Section title text "Real - Time Earthquake Detection Around The World" on the dashboard page so it appears a little smaller across breakpoints, without changing the title wording, alignment, or layout.

On the dashboard hero section (frontend/src/pages/EarthquakeDashboard.tsx), add a new subtitle line directly below the existing centered hero title "Real - Time Earthquake Detection Around The World". The subtitle must be rendered as an H2 and must read exactly: "Latest real-time earthquake information around the world". Keep the subtitle centered and visually secondary to the main hero title (smaller size and/or muted color), without changing the existing hero title wording, alignment, or layout.

Fix the layout/scrolling of the earthquake results table so the bottom of the table list is not visually cropped and the last row can be fully viewed in all view modes (Table and Split). Address the height interaction between the fixed 600px table scroll container in `frontend/src/components/earthquake/EarthquakeResultsTable.tsx` and the `h-[600px] overflow-hidden` wrapper used in Split view in `frontend/src/pages/EarthquakeDashboard.tsx`.

Fix the Split view layout so the Map card and the Table card do not get vertically clipped due to nested fixed heights (e.g., a fixed-height wrapper in `frontend/src/pages/EarthquakeDashboard.tsx` combined with the fixed `h-[600px]` map container in `frontend/src/components/earthquake/EarthquakeMapView.tsx`). Update the layout so that, in Split view, both cards fit cleanly within their containers and the table body remains scrollable with the sticky header staying visible, matching expected behavior shown in the uploaded screenshot.

Make the Dashboard Split view layout responsive across mobile, tablet, and desktop so the Map card and the Earthquake Results table card are usable without clipping, forced fixed heights, or awkward scrolling.
Improve the Earthquake Results table responsiveness within Split view so it works well on narrow widths (e.g., mobile portrait) while preserving all existing columns and interactions.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create an earthquake detection website that pulls and displays earthquake data from open-source internet sources using modern web UI elements and libraries.
Add a live/interactive map view that displays recent earthquake events geographically (pins/markers) and updates with the selected feed/filters.
Update app branding/header: change the left-corner label/title from "Seismic Monitor" to "WhoFeelAnEarthquake" (including the website title).
Include a tsunami warning indicator/field in the earthquake events table (where available from the data source).
Set the provided icon as the site favicon (add/update favicon assets and link tags so browsers display it).
Add an MMI (Modified Mercalli Intensity) scale status line below the existing status on the earthquake event popup/details view.

Fix performance lag when switching to larger time windows (e.g., Past Hour → Past Week) by optimizing map marker rendering (only render markers in visible bounds) and virtualizing/limiting rendered table rows.
Ensure Past Week and Past Month views show only events within the selected time window (not cumulatively including Past Hour/Day), and sort/display results appropriately for those windows.
Add moment tensor information to the earthquake results table and to the earthquake details/description popup (where available from USGS data).
Replace the homepage/hero banner image with centered title text: "Real - Time Earthquake Detection Around The World".
Adjust the dashboard header/title text styling to be slightly smaller (reduce font size).
Add an H2 subtitle text below the main hero title: "Latest real-time earthquake information around the world".
Fix UI layout issue where the earthquake results table/list is cropped at the bottom (ensure full table height/scrolling is visible).
Improve Split view table responsiveness so it adapts well across device sizes/breakpoints (mobile/tablet/desktop) without clipping or layout issues.

projectName: Earthquake detection website using open-source USGS earthquake feeds
